Articles.Content:
Here's the relevant bit of ksp.log if it helps:

Spoiler

[LOG 18:36:30.534] [F: 104073]: [04:39:58]: Jebediah Kerman from Kerbal X went on EVA.
[LOG 18:36:30.600] [FLIGHT GLOBALS]: Switching To Vessel Jebediah Kerman ----------------------
[LOG 18:36:30.602] [PlanetariumCamera]: Focus: Jebediah Kerman
[WRN 18:36:30.609] [Part]: kerbalEVA (Jebediah Kerman) holds crew but has no interior model defined!
[LOG 18:36:33.363] There are Kerbals on a ladder. Cannot save
[LOG 18:37:03.379] Active Vessel is about to crash. Cannot save
[LOG 18:37:33.397] Flight State Captured
[LOG 18:37:33.397] Saving Achievements Tree...
[LOG 18:37:33.397] Saving Achievements Tree...
[LOG 18:37:33.398] Saving Achievements Tree...
[LOG 18:37:33.398] [MessageSystem] Save Messages
[LOG 18:37:33.410] Game State Saved to saves/Rocket Surgery/persistent
[LOG 18:37:33.410] [AutoSave]: Game Backed Up and Saved
[LOG 18:37:55.979] Packing Kerbal X for orbit
[LOG 18:38:23.812] [Kerbal X]: ground contact! - error: 0.000m
[LOG 18:38:23.812] Unpacking Kerbal X
[LOG 18:38:50.842] Flight State Captured
[LOG 18:38:50.842] Saving Achievements Tree...
[LOG 18:38:50.843] Saving Achievements Tree...
[LOG 18:38:50.843] Saving Achievements Tree...
[LOG 18:38:50.844] [MessageSystem] Save Messages
[LOG 18:38:50.844] [Progress Node Reached]: FlagPlant
[LOG 18:38:50.845] [Progress Node Complete]: FlagPlant
[LOG 18:39:10.256] UIMasterController: ShowUI
[LOG 18:39:10.256] Game Paused!
[LOG 18:39:13.023] [FlightDriver]: Flight State Reverted to Prelaunch.
[LOG 18:39:13.027] Game State Saved as persistent
[LOG 18:39:13.029] UIMasterController: HideUI

I remember reading somewhere that wheels and landing struts were similar parts of code, or something. I verified that I couldn't kick wheels or they wouldn't kick back while on EVA, so that much seems to be fixed.

--

Edited June 23, 2016 by Gordon Fecyk
Forgot to mention about wheels working better

Hi Gordon, Squad is aware of the issues with legs (and wheels) and will be addressing these as they continue to update to newer versions of Unity which will make fixes possible.

But for the time being try to keep Kerbals away from landing legs, thank you.
